column9: I have been taking narcotic pain relievers for 35 years. When I was young I had a horrible experience with morphine shots (10 mg/4 hours) for acute post operation pain. Then it started to lose effectiveness and my doctor rotated me to 2x200 mg mscontin/6 hours plus about 15 30 mg plain morphine per day. This has provided me excellent relief. I will probably ask to go back to the fentanyl/oxycodone mix in a month or two, past experience tells me that a new medication falls off in effect after three weeks.I should say that I have been seeing this doc for some years and I saw my previous doc for many years. column9: I have been using MS Contin this time for about eight years, as much as 270 mg per day.  I have cut down the amount on my own due to concerns it is affecting my breathing. It seems that when I cut the use of the MS Contin a lot, my breathing gets better and I have little or no congestion, and I dont need the puffers.  When I raise it again, my congestion and breathing get worse.  I havent experimented enough to be sure that it is the MS Contin causing the breathing problems and I always think my doctors would say so if it was the MS Contin.  My Neurologist for MS insists the MS is not causing the breathing difficulties but other doctors insist it is.  As for pain relief, it is the best thing I have ever found, I have used all kinds of different drugs, acupuncture, which works but not continuously, T.E.N.S., everything imaginable.  Even if it turns out to be the MS Contin causing the breathing difficulties I still have to wonder which is more important, quality of life as in pain free, or easy breathing without puffers.  Has anyone else had any experience with breathing difficulties after using MS Contin for extended periods of time?  The first time I used MS Contin was for about one year and only 30 mg twice daily.  I should also mention when I am not using MS Contin regularly, I am confined to a motorized wheelchair, and have to drive with hand controls.  When I use high dose MS Contin I can walk and ride a bicycle; although not far.  Further, when I use the MS Contin I feel good, I feel healthy, and as I said I can walk, ride a bike, even exercise with weights.  This is a really tough decision and my doctors have pretty much left it up to me, as one of them said, Quality of life is often more important then any other concerns.
